aws::graph::propositions: # Rudder Gust Lock System Information
The rudder gust lock prevents rudder surface movement due to ground gusts by locking the rudder control system at the rear fuselage torque tube.
The rudder gust lock system has a TLA (Thrust Lever Angle) interlock to preclude in-flight uncommanded locking.
The rudder gust lock system has a WOW (Weight-on-Wheels) interlock to preclude in-flight uncommanded locking.
No maintenance is required over the rudder gust lock actuator's life.
The gust lock system comprises the aileron/rudder/elevator gust lock cockpit assembly.
The gust lock system comprises the gust lock safety pin.
The gust lock system comprises the rudder gust lock mechanism.
The gust lock system comprises the gust lock quadrant.
The rudder gust lock mechanism includes a gust lock actuator.
The rudder gust lock mechanism includes a command spring.
The rudder gust lock mechanism includes a bellcrank.
The rudder gust lock mechanism includes a control box with connector.
The bellcrank is pivoted by the action of the actuator.
The bellcrank locks one of the grooves on the gust lock quadrant.
The gust lock quadrant is connected to the rudder rear torque tube.
The bellcrank prevents the movement of the rudder surface in case of wind gust.
The aileron control system is mechanically locked by means of the installation of the gust lock pin in the pilot's control yoke assembly.
The elevator control system is mechanically locked by means of the installation of the gust lock pin in the pilot's control yoke assembly.
The rudder control system gust lock mechanism is actuated through an electromechanical actuator.
When the gust lock safety pin is inserted into the pilot's control wheel, two switches are activated.
The activated switches provide automatic engagement of the rudder gust lock system.
When the aileron and elevator control systems are unlocked by the removal of the gust pin, the rudder gust lock system is designed to be automatically disengaged.
The rudder gust lock system in a locked position is evident to the pilots when the gust lock pin is inserted in its hole.
The rudder gust lock system in a locked position is evident to the pilots when both pedals are locked in a deflected position.
The rudder gust lock system in a locked position is evident to the pilots when the aircraft cannot taxi with rudder surface locked.

text:
# Rudder Gust Lock System

## Function
The function of the rudder gust lock is to prevent rudder surface movement due to ground gusts by locking the rudder control system at the rear fuselage torque tube.

## Interlocks
In order to preclude in-flight uncommanded locking, the system has the following interlocks:
* TLA (Thrust Lever Angle)
* WOW (Weight-on-Wheels)

## Maintenance
No maintenance is required over the rudder gust lock actuators life.

## Components
The gust lock system comprises the following elements:
* Aileron/rudder/elevator gust lock cockpit assembly
* Gust lock safety pin
* Rudder gust lock mechanism
* Gust lock quadrant

The rudder gust lock mechanism has the following elements:
* Gust lock actuator
* Command spring
* Bellcrank
* Control box with connector

The bellcrank, pivoted by the action of the actuator, locks one of the grooves on the gust lock quadrant, which is connected to the rudder rear torque tube, thereby preventing the movement of the rudder surface in case of wind gust.

## Operation
The aileron control system and the elevator control system are mechanically locked by means of the installation of the gust lock pin in the pilot's control yoke assembly. The rudder control system gust lock mechanism is actuated through an electromechanical actuator.

When the gust lock safety pin is inserted into the pilot's control wheel to lock the aileron and elevator control system, two switches are activated, providing automatic engagement of the rudder gust lock system.

When the aileron and elevator control systems are unlocked by the removal of the gust pin, the rudder gust lock system is designed to be automatically disengaged. As designed, the rudder gust lock system in a locked position is evident to the pilots because of the following conditions:
* Gust lock pin is inserted in its hole.
* Both pedals are locked in a deflected position.
* Aircraft cannot taxi with rudder surface locked.

---
